column4: I can connect to the current desktop on the remote machine, but I want to log on to another X session
ah, you mean vnc into a computer and bring up a login?
I did this but I either don't get a stable connection (reset by remote socket) or I only see a blank X surface
not sure what to do then, that should just work, do you get any errors on the server in a log somewhere?
None that I'd knew about... On Windows side the VNC client sometimes crashes with socket exceptions
Have you dome something like that yet?
Do I need to run x11vnc on a different display for remote connections? If so, how do I do this?
the stuff in xinetd should start a new display for incoming connections
But without a server running on startup there won't be any incoming connections... so I might have to start the server manually?
I don't think you understand inetd, it starts a process when a request is made to use a port
Now the client cannot connect to the service... looks like there is nothing starting up
have you rebooted since going through all the steps in the page I linked for you?
I'm stumped without looking at it, sorry :(
I'm a lil' busy right now at work, if you want some help, send an e-mail to disasm@gentux.org and I'll get back to you later
